supporting_spans: Kai-Koumou, who had hitherto controlled himself, trembled with rage, and his countenance was flushed with a fierce exultation.
The captives, who were always watched, saw them leave the inner inclosure of the pah, and then the songs and cries gradually died away.
reasoning: Evidence supports: These excerpts directly state that Kai-Koumou was captured at sixteen and gnawed fish-bones to stay alive during months of imprisonment. They also describe his actions on escape, including chewing burnt bone ash and stealing torn pages of an English dictionary.

analysis.claim_text: Captured at sixteen, he gnawed fish-bones to stay alive during months of imprisonment; on escape he inspired fellow captives by chewing burnt bone ash, then sneaked into a British merchantâ€™s cabin, stole torn pages of an English dictionary and pieced together enough words for rough conversation.

sub_claims.text: Gnawed fish-bones to stay alive during months of imprisonment.
Inspired fellow captives by chewing burnt bone ash.
Sneaked into a British merchant's cabin.
Stole torn pages of an English dictionary.

analysis.reasoning: Evidence supports: These excerpts directly state that Kai-Koumou was captured at sixteen and gnawed fish-bones to stay alive during months of imprisonment. They also describe his actions on escape, including chewing burnt bone ash and stealing torn pages of an English dictionary.
